snippet: Reddit, built on open-source software and guided by the ethos of its community of 20 million users a month, is a classic Web start-up in which opportunity seems mixed with barely controlled anarchy.
abstract: David Carr The Media Equation column observes that social site Reddit, built on open-source software and guided by the ethos of its community of 20 million users a month, is a classic Web start-up in which opportunity seems mixed with barely controlled anarchy; notes that Advance Publications bought Reddit in 2006 for a reported $20 million.
lead_paragraph: Reddit, built on open-source software and guided by the ethos of its community of 20 million users a month, is a classic Web start-up in which opportunity seems mixed with barely controlled anarchy.

headline.seo: Reddit Thrives Under Hands-Off Policy of Advance Publications
headline.main: Left Alone by Its Owner, Reddit Soars
headline.print_headline: Left Alone By Its Owner, Reddit Soars
